body: The Bahrain News Agency (BNA) is the state news agency of Bahrain. The BNA was established in 1976 with the name of the Gulf News Agency. In 2001 it was renamed as the Bahrain News Agency. The agency is run under the Ministry of Information Affairs. It is a member of the Federation of Arab News Agencies (FANA). The BNA has both Arabic and English publications and is based in Manama. In July 2013, the agency launched BNA Zaman, a service which documents Bahrain's landmark development achievements via pictures. BNA is an active member of the Federation of Arab News Agencies (FANA) that includes the national news agencies of 18 Arab countries. https://www.bna.bh/en/
